alert.note: Alert for Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:57PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pitkin County through 630 PM MDT... At 557 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Aspen, or 31 miles southeast of Glenwood Springs, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Pitkin County, including the following locations... Woody Creek, Meridith and Snowmass Village. This includes Colorado 82 between mile markers 32 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
